avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The sometimes deep wind slabs can be released easily or naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

In particular on very steep slopes and at the base of rock walls medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.
Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude. As a consequence of warming moist avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1500 m.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
The high temperatures from the early morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. Dry avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday.
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again.

Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released easily. or in isolated cases naturally,, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Dry avalanches can in isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach medium size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. This also applies in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size.
In some places wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed critically, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

As a consequence of warming small to medium-sized moist avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger. As a consequence of warming moist avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
